Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Card>
          • CardList
            • Hand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Card>, java.util.Collection<Card>, java.util.List<Card>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public final class Hand
extends CardList
    This class is the representation of one player's hand. It contains all cards in hand.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

        The constructor initializes the hand with a default size of MAXIMUM_NUM_OF_CARDS

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(Card card)
        Add a card to the hand. The hand's size must not exceed MAXIMUM_NUM_OF_CARDS after addition.
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Collection<Card>
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.List<Card>
        Overrides:
        add in class java.util.ArrayList<Card>
        Parameters:
        card - the card to be added
        Returns:
        true if the card is successfully added, false otherwise

      • add

        public boolean add(Card[] cards)
        Add multiple cards to the hand. The hand's size must not exceed MAXIMUM_NUM_OF_CARDS after addition.
        Parameters:
        cards - the array of cards to be added
        Returns:
        true if the cards are all successfully added, false if any one of them failed to be added
